item.title: Simple Things Matter
item.description: Often in life we rush through things we’ve done so many times we feel they are simple. Some times they are simple, but in social contexts it is easy to forget how a little time taken to be intentional can help others (or ourselves) in the future. One example of this I encounter almost daily is git commit messages. Often you will see one-liners such as “fixed typo” or “squashed bug” â€“ most likely meaningful enough to the person who just spent hours tracking down the typo or figuring out how to fix the bug.
